revised_title: Deciphering the Inscription on a Punic Coin from the Isle of Gozo
tldr: The author, John Swinton, examines a Punic coin from the Isle of Gozo and deciphers the inscription on it. He explains that the coin was struck in the Mediterranean island of Gozo, which was known as GAVLOS in ancient times. Swinton provides a detailed analysis of the coin's inscription, comparing it to other similar coins and explaining the historical context of the island and its connection to the Phoenicians and Carthaginians.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Numismatics
